label: flowerShape controlled vocabulary
definition: A SKOS ConceptScheme to be used as a controlled vocabulary for the Plant-Pollinator Interactions term ppi:flowerShape

label: dish
definition: Dish- to bowl-shaped flowers

label: bell-funnel
definition: Convex contour (bell) or straight or concave (funnel) shaped flowers

label: brush
definition: Perianth is reduced or split into filiform segments interspersed between sexual organs

label: flag
definition: The flag type shows the same division of the pollination unit into an upper and lower part, but in this case the sexual organs are found in the lower part, and the insects carry the pollen on their abdominal side (sternotribic)

label: gullet
definition: Flower shape where sexual orgargs are restricted to the functionally upper side of the pollination unit, and pollen is deposited on the back (upper side of the head) of the pollinator (nototribic)

label: tube
definition: Tubes may be central, as a corolla tube, subcentric, as a spur, or excentric. The sub- and excentric types may be convergent with or divergent from the main axis of the blossom. Tubes and spurs are usually single or double, and has multiple, subcentric convergent spurs. Many composite heads are also multitubula.

label: flowerOrientation controlled vocabulary
definition: A SKOS ConceptScheme to be used as a controlled vocabulary for the Plant-Pollinator Interactions term ppi:flowerOrientation

label: vertical
definition: Flower facing upwards

label: horizontal
definition: Flower roughly parallel to the ground

label: pendant
definition: Flower facing downwards

label: longitudinal
definition: Dehiscing along long axis of theca

label: poricidal
definition: Dehiscing through a pore at apex of theca

label: transverse
definition: Dehiscing at rightangles to long axis of theca

label: valvular
definition: Dehiscing through a pore covered by a flap of tissue

label: apomiticSystemEmbryoOrigin controlled vocabulary
definition: A SKOS ConceptScheme to be used as a controlled vocabulary for the Plant-Pollinator Interactions term ppi:apomiticSystemEmbryoOrigin

label: gametophytic
definition: In this kind of apomixis, the embryo develops through parthenogenesis from the egg cell of an unreduced embryo sac

label: sporophytic
definition: In sporophytic apomixis (adventitious embryony), the embryo originates from somatic cells of the ovule, usually from the nucellus or integument, and it commonly develops in parallel with the sexual embryo

label: apomiticSystemFertilization controlled vocabulary
definition: A SKOS ConceptScheme to be used as a controlled vocabulary for the Plant-Pollinator Interactions term ppi:apomiticSystemFertilization

label: autonomous
definition: Autonomous apomixis occurs when embryo and the endosperm can develop independently of fertilization

label: pseudogamy
definition: pseudogamous ones depend on the fertilization of the polar nucleus or nuclei by a male gamete to endosperm development

label: apomiticSystemReproduction controlled vocabulary
definition: A SKOS ConceptScheme to be used as a controlled vocabulary for the Plant-Pollinator Interactions term ppi:apomiticSystemReproduction

label: facultative
definition: This type is recognized when the apomixis occurs in parallel with sexual reproduction

label: obligate
definition: It is characterized by reproduction exclusively via apomixis

label: matingSystem controlled vocabulary
definition: A SKOS ConceptScheme to be used as a controlled vocabulary for the Plant-Pollinator Interactions term ppi:matingSystem

label: autogamy
definition: Autogamy consists in the fertilization of male and female gametes from the same flower after self-pollination, which may happen only in bisexual flowers

label: geitonogamy
definition: Consists in the fertilization between gametes from different flowers of the same individual after geitonogamous pollination

label: xenogamy
definition: Xenogamy is the fertilization of gametes from flowers of different individuals after cross-pollination

label: sexualSystem controlled vocabulary
definition: A SKOS ConceptScheme to be used as a controlled vocabulary for the Plant-Pollinator Interactions term ppi:sexualSystem

label: cosexuality
definition: Sexual system in which individuals of a population present only bisexual flowers (androgynous, cosexual, hermaphrodite, monoclinous or perfect flowers), with functional stamens and pistils in the same flower

label: monoecy
definition: Sexual system in which a population present only unisexual (diclinous) flowers and both staminate and pistillate flowers occur in the same individual

label: andromonoecy
definition: Sexual system in which individuals of a population present bisexual and staminate flowers (Fig. 3), which may have a reduced, non-functional or even absent gynoecium

label: gynomonoecy
definition: Sexual system in which individuals of a population present both bisexual and pistillate flowers, with pollen sterility and a reduced or absent androecium

label: trimonoecy
definition: Trimonoecy is characterized by the presence of three floral types within the same individual in a population: bisexual, staminate and pistillate flowers

label: dioecy
definition: In this sexual system, entire individuals are unisexual, which means staminate and pistillate flowers are arranged in different plants of a population

label: androdioecy
definition: Androdioecy is the presence of individuals with bisexual flowers coexisting along with others that present only staminate flowers (Fig. 4), and it is related to mutations that cause female sterility

label: gynodioecy
definition: Gynodioecy refers to the presence of individuals with bisexual flowers coexisting along with others with only pistillate flowers

label: floralAttractants controlled vocabulary
definition: A SKOS ConceptScheme to be used as a controlled vocabulary for the Plant-Pollinator Interactions term ppi:floralAttractants

label: visual
definition: Visual stimuli

label: chemical
definition: Chemical stimuli

label: tactile
definition: Tactile stimuli

label: sonorous
definition: Sonorous stimuli

label: floralSystem controlled vocabulary
definition: A SKOS ConceptScheme to be used as a controlled vocabulary for the Plant-Pollinator Interactions term ppi:floralSystem

label: herkogamy
definition: Herkogamy is the spatial separation anther-stigma along the vertical or horizontal plane within the same flower, functioning as a physical barrier that prevents both interference between sexual functions and self-pollination

label: heterostyly
definition: Heterostyly occurs when populations present individuals with two (distyly) or three (tristyly) floral morphs, which reciprocally differ in the heights of anthers and stigmas within flowers

label: stylar dimorphism
definition: Characterized by the presence of two morphs in the population differing only in style heights

label: heteranthery
definition: Heteranthery is characterized by the morphological, spatial and/or color differentiation among the stamens of the same flower

label: enantiostyly
definition: This floral system is characterized by the lateral deflection of style (to the right or left) in relation to the central axis of the flower leading to horizontal herkogamy

label: cleistogamy
definition: Refers to the presence of flowers that do not open, and which set fruits and seeds only via self-pollination

label: resupinate dimorphy
definition: In this floral system, approximately half the population have exclusively resupinate flowers (upside down) while the other individuals have normal, non-resupinate ones

label: dichogamy
definition: Dichogamy consists in temporal separation of sexual functions, either at different times of anthesis of staminate and pistillate flowers, or by the sequential ripening of the androecium or gynoecium within the same flower or inflorescence

label: heterodichogamy
definition: Dichogamy may be non-synchronized in flowers of the same individual, but also occur in a synchronized manner, generating functional dioecy in the population

label: flexistyly
definition: This is a complex floral system which combines both reciprocal herkogamy and heterodichogamy. In flexistyly, populations have protandrous and protogynous individuals (type II heterodichogamy; see above), which occur generally in the same frequencies

label: movements of floral whorls
definition: Floral movements have been appointed as mechanisms to avoid self-pollination, and new evidence indicates that they reduce intrafloral male-female interference as well

label: selfIncompatibilityType controlled vocabulary
definition: A SKOS ConceptScheme to be used as a controlled vocabulary for the Plant-Pollinator Interactions term ppi:selfIncompatibilityType

label: gametophytic
definition: Gametophytic self-incompatibility occurs in flower homomorphic plants and is controlled by a single locus S containing several alleles with absence of dominance

label: sporophytic homomorphic
definition: This system also occurs in plant populations with only one floral type and is also genetically controlled by a single S locus, which contains multiple alleles within the same population

label: sporophytic heteromorphic
definition: This system shares functional characteristics with SSI, but involves flowers with different structures (e.g. pistil and/or stamen lengths) within the same population

label: late-acting
definition: This is a homomorphic incompatibility system in which pollen tubes from self-pollination are not inhibited before reaching the ovary, and may even penetrate the ovules
